  • Field Details

    • LOG_LEVEL

      private static LogLevel LOG_LEVEL
      Global log level. Message which log level value is higher that this field's value will be skipped

    • COUNT_MESSAGES

      private static boolean COUNT_MESSAGES
      If counters should be incremented. If set to false all counters will be left at 0

    • PRINT_TO_STD_OUT

      private static boolean PRINT_TO_STD_OUT
      If Logger should print log entries to standard output stream

    • TS_FORMAT

      private static java.lang.String TS_FORMAT
      Timestamp format to be used when creating log entry. Should be set accordingly to Java's SimpleDateFormat structure

    • PRINT_TO_FILE

      private static boolean PRINT_TO_FILE
      If Logger should save log entries to file

    • LOG_FILE_PATH

      private static java.lang.String LOG_FILE_PATH
      Path to file in which log entries will be saved (if PRINT_TO_FILE is set to true). Please provide absolute path

    • counter_fatal

      public static int counter_fatal
      Count of messages with respective log level that were received by the Logger. Represents how many times a message with respective log level was received by the Logger.
      Unless log level is set to OFF or COUNT_MESSAGES is set to false - all messages will be taken into account.
      Counters will be incremented even if PRINT_TO_FILE and PRINT_TO_STDOUT are set to false.

    • counter_error

      public static int counter_error
      Count of messages with respective log level that were received by the Logger. Represents how many times a message with respective log level was received by the Logger.
      Unless log level is set to OFF or COUNT_MESSAGES is set to false - all messages will be taken into account.
      Counters will be incremented even if PRINT_TO_FILE and PRINT_TO_STDOUT are set to false.

    • counter_warn

      public static int counter_warn
      Count of messages with respective log level that were received by the Logger. Represents how many times a message with respective log level was received by the Logger.
      Unless log level is set to OFF or COUNT_MESSAGES is set to false - all messages will be taken into account.
      Counters will be incremented even if PRINT_TO_FILE and PRINT_TO_STDOUT are set to false.

    • counter_info

      public static int counter_info
      Count of messages with respective log level that were received by the Logger. Represents how many times a message with respective log level was received by the Logger.
      Unless log level is set to OFF or COUNT_MESSAGES is set to false - all messages will be taken into account.
      Counters will be incremented even if PRINT_TO_FILE and PRINT_TO_STDOUT are set to false.

    • counter_debug

      public static int counter_debug
      Count of messages with respective log level that were received by the Logger. Represents how many times a message with respective log level was received by the Logger.
      Unless log level is set to OFF or COUNT_MESSAGES is set to false - all messages will be taken into account.
      Counters will be incremented even if PRINT_TO_FILE and PRINT_TO_STDOUT are set to false.

    • counter_trace

      public static int counter_trace
      Count of messages with respective log level that were received by the Logger. Represents how many times a message with respective log level was received by the Logger.
      Unless log level is set to OFF or COUNT_MESSAGES is set to false - all messages will be taken into account.
      Counters will be incremented even if PRINT_TO_FILE and PRINT_TO_STDOUT are set to false.

  • Constructor Details

    • Logger

      private Logger()

  • Method Details

    • log

      public static void log​(java.lang.String message, LogLevel level) throws javax.naming.ConfigurationException, java.io.IOException
      Main method that logs provided message.
      Parameters:
      message - message to be logged
      level - log level of provided message
      Throws:
      javax.naming.ConfigurationException - when PRINT_TO_FILE is set to true but LOG_FILE_PATH was not set/
      java.io.IOException - if failed to access log file, e.g. due to insufficient permissions

    • print_to_file

      private static void print_to_file​(java.lang.String entry) throws javax.naming.ConfigurationException, java.io.IOException
      Saves log entry to log file
      Parameters:
      entry - log entry to be saved in log file
      Throws:
      javax.naming.ConfigurationException - if path to log file was not specified.
      java.io.IOException - if failed to access log file

    • create_log_entry

      private static java.lang.String create_log_entry​(java.lang.String msg, LogLevel lvl)
      Generates a log entry. Entry will include a timestamp, message's log level and message's content
      Parameters:
      msg - message's content
      lvl - message's log level
      Returns:
      a String object - a log entry

    • increment_log_level

      private static void increment_log_level​(LogLevel lvl)
      Increment value of respective counter for provided log level value
      Parameters:
      lvl - LogLevel for respective counter to be incremented

    • readEnvs

      public static void readEnvs() throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
      Sets Logger class fields' values basing on environmental variables. ENVs names must match Logger class field names
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if failed to set value of any field of class Logger

    • get_config

      public static java.lang.String get_config() throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
      Provides current values of Logger class fields
      Returns:
      a String object containing names and current values of Logger class fields
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if failed to access field value
